text.section:
An applicant for a license to act as a licensed other tobacco products manufacturer shall:
submit an application to the Comptroller on the form and containing the information that the Comptroller requires; and
pay to the Comptroller a fee of $25.

section.section:
An applicant for a license to act as an other tobacco products retailer or a tobacconist:
shall obtain a county license by submitting to the clerk an application for each permanent or temporary place of business located in the same enclosure and operated by the same applicant; and
except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, shall pay to the clerk a fee of $15.
A person who has a license issued under Title 16 of this article to act as a cigarette retailer or to act as a special cigarette retailer is not required to pay the license fee.

The application shall:
be made on the form that the clerk requires; and
contain the information that the Comptroller requires.

text.section:
An applicant for a license to act as an other tobacco products storage warehouse shall:
submit an application to the Comptroller on the form and containing the information that the Comptroller requires; and
pay to the Comptroller a fee of $25.

section.section:
An applicant for a license to act as an other tobacco products wholesaler shall:
submit an application to the Comptroller on the form and containing the information that the Comptroller requires; and
except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, pay to the Comptroller a fee of $250.
A person who has a license issued under Title 16 of this article to act as a cigarette wholesaler is not required to pay the license fee.

text.section: A licensee shall display a license in the way that the Comptroller requires by regulation.
If a person has had a license revoked under § 16.5-208 of this subtitle, the person may not reapply for a license within 1 year after the date when the prior license was revoked.
